This measure word is used for objects or items that are considered as a whole or a unit, such as pieces of furniture, cakes, or other solid objects.

å‡º (chÅ«)

This word generally means "to go out" or "to come out," and is used to indicate movement away from a place or origin.



æ¥ (lÃ¡i)

This word generally means "to come" or "to arrive," and is used to indicate movement toward a place or destination.



For example, you would use å‡º (chÅ«) when describing leaving a location or going out, while you would use æ¥ (lÃ¡i) when describing arriving at a location or coming to a place.
